goals.question: What is the distribution of BMI among the population?
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us understand the spread of BMI values among the population and identify any potential outliers.

goals.question: Is there a correlation between BMI and physical activity?
goals.visualization: Scatter plot of BMI vs Physical Activity
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us identify any correlation between BMI and physical activity levels, which can help us understand the impact of physical activity on BMI.

goals.question: What is the distribution of obesity levels among different age groups?
goals.visualization: Bar chart of Obesity levels by Age Group
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us understand the prevalence of obesity among different age groups and identify any trends or patterns.

goals.question: What is the distribution of obesity levels among different countries?
goals.visualization: Bar chart of Obesity levels by Country
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us understand the prevalence of obesity among different countries and identify any potential factors that may contribute to higher obesity rates in certain countries.

goals.question: What is the relationship between BMI and obesity levels?
goals.visualization: Box plot of BMI by Obesity Level
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us understand the relationship between BMI and obesity levels and identify any potential thresholds or cutoffs for different obesity levels based on BMI values.

code:
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import matplotlib.ticker as ticker

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    plt.figure(figsize=(6, 6))
    plt.hist(data['BMI'], bins=20, edgecolor='black')
    plt.xlabel('BMI')
    plt.ylabel('Frequency')
    plt.title('What is the distribution of BMI among the population?')
    
    if len(plt.xticks()[0]) > 20:
        plt.gca().xaxis.set_major_locator(ticker.MaxNLocator(20))
    
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)
chart.show()

import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import matplotlib.ticker as ticker
import pandas as pd

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    plt.figure(figsize=(6, 6))
    plt.scatter(data['BMI'], data['Physical_Activity'])
    plt.xlabel('BMI')
    plt.ylabel('Physical Activity')
    plt.title('Is there a correlation between BMI and physical activity?')
    
    if len(plt.xticks()[0]) > 20:
        plt.gca().xaxis.set_major_locator(ticker.MaxNLocator(20))
    
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)
chart.show()

import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import matplotlib.ticker as ticker

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    plt.figure(figsize=(6, 6))
    
    age_group_obesity = data.groupby('Age Group')['Obesity'].mean()
    age_group_obesity.plot(kind='bar')
    
    plt.xlabel('Age Group')
    plt.ylabel('Obesity Levels')
    plt.title('What is the distribution of obesity levels among different age groups?')
    
    if len(plt.xticks()[0]) > 20:
        plt.gca().xaxis.set_major_locator(ticker.MaxNLocator(20))
    
    plt.xticks(rotation=45)
    
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)
chart.show()

import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import matplotlib.ticker as ticker

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    plt.figure(figsize=(6, 6))
    ax = data.plot.bar(x='Country', y='Obesity levels', rot=45)
    if len(plt.xticks()[0]) > 20:
        ax.xaxis.set_major_locator(ticker.MaxNLocator(20))
    plt.title("What is the distribution of obesity levels among different countries?", wrap=True)
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)
chart.show()

import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import matplotlib.ticker as ticker

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    plt.figure(figsize=(6, 6))
    ax = data.boxplot(column='BMI', by='Obesity_Level')
    plt.title('What is the relationship between BMI and obesity levels?')
    plt.suptitle('')
    plt.xlabel('Obesity Level')
    plt.ylabel('BMI')
    
    if len(plt.xticks()[0]) > 20:
        ax.xaxis.set_major_locator(ticker.MaxNLocator(20))
    
    plt.xticks(rotation=45)
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)
chart.show()
